content:
Hey, I made an easy version of this puzzle without realising there was already a hard version (I was thinking of making a hard version later).

Let me know what you think of the easy one and if you think it's worth having both?

https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/1201357bc6caad8a49cde8b385593250094a50?comment=350383

I had "_" as the empty spaces originally, but changed to "."s now to match your inputs.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Thanks fir this puzzle!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I would love to see this accepted, did a lot of them on paper, hope a last person will validate it !
Your constraint is n <= 20, but you don't have any tests larger than 12
For clarity, I would change "no identical rows or columns." by "no identical rows and no identical columns." since a row can be identical to a column (if you convert them in binary).

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun puzzle.  Probably should be medium.

I like this logic puzzle. Good job.

i think the difficulty of puzzle is hard. It's similar difficulty to https://www.codingame.com/training/hard/pedestrian-traffic and https://www.codingame.com/training/hard/harmless-rooks. Even if you know what you need to check its still plenty of coding.

In statement I would add, that each test has only one  possible solution.

Hello,
If you have code improvement idea, don't hesitate to submit them to me so I can improve the solution.
You're welcome to do any other suggestion, I would be glad to improve the puzzle.

Cool one! I read too fast the statement, I think constraints should be displayed as list instead of paragraph, something like:

The objective is to fill the grid with 1s and 0s, constraints are:

- an equal number of 1s and 0s in each row and column
- no more than two of either number adjacent to each other
- no identical rows or columns.

Hello Konstant,

Thank you for your comment ;)

I'm not sure that it's a hard puzzle, because there is a Sudoku solver and Futoshiki solver in medium puzzle.
https://www.codingame.com/training/medium/futoshiki-solver
https://www.codingame.com/training/medium/sudoku-solver
They are also logical puzzles in a square grid with a recursive solution.
What do you think about it ?

I added the only one solution in the statement.

Thank you ;)
It was firstly medium, then I changed it to hard according to Konstant's comment. So I don't really know what to do...
I don't know a lot about hard puzzles, because i don't try it, and i did manage to solve yours... Just to say.

Most medium puzzles have solution of 10-20 lines. Hard solutions have many more lines of code.

According to this sudoku should also be hard, because it's more time absorbing.
Ok, I've changed it to hard puzzle.

Nice tip Alcalyn, thank you.
I've changed it ;) !
